channel.title: Making a webclient
channel.description: I wondering if someone could be as kind as to walk me through making a webclient for serber. What do I need and how does it work, thanks.

item.title: Making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @stEps stEps
item.description:
@stEps wrote:

the problem is that when i go to the website it will pop up a java i click run and it loads a client out of the webpage. How do i get it to load inside the webpage… i am using tag and I have changed the loading of the files from where i made them download.

what am i missing?? what other source files need editing?!?!?

Read full topic

item.title: Making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“stEps, post:7, topic:544990”]i got it as an applet. when i look in my processes running it says jp2 launcher(this is an applet)… my html is fine. any ideas?

Edit: when i searched around, back in october cleako had this same problem where the cleint would open in its own window and not in the browser.[/quote]
JP2 launcher is not an applet it does exactly what you described. With the applet tags you can embed the client to the web page which is what you requested.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @stEps stEps
item.description:
@stEps wrote:

i got it as an applet. when i look in my processes running it says jp2 launcher(this is an applet)… my html is fine. any ideas?

Edit: when i searched around, back in october cleako had this same problem where the cleint would open in its own window and not in the browser.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“stEps, post:5, topic:544990”]where is the loading at? config?
edit: Now when i go to the webpage it opens up a client and load it. I want it to be in the webpage not in a client… help me out here panu :|[/quote]
I think you implemented a JNLP launcher and not applet.

<applet archive="url to jar here" code="class path to mudclient"/>

Also take a look at for cache downloader:
https://github.com/CodeForFame/Client/tree/master/src/org/rscdaemon/client/util

Read full topic

item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

stEps:

ok, so now you can no longer run it without it being signed? I’ve read that it needs to been signed to be able to run now, how can I do this free?

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/deployment/jar/signing.html
